result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles W Smith in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CF538, Court grants the State's motion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Charles W Smith in court with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.   Mary Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant for non-compliance addressed on file 14CF538. Defense addresses blood test results and requests another date for plea/sentencing. Defense requests the trial date be cancelled.   Court will set another date for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with  victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Charles W Smith in court with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.  Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests bail be modified from $2000.00 cash to $2000.00 signature bond. Court grants request and modifies bail to $2000.00 sig bond with the same conditions. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over. Case continued w/file 14CF538.  Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification filed by Attorney Jorge Fragoso.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Charles W Smith in court, in custody.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states that Attorney Jorge Fragoso was to come and see him in the jail, but did not come to see him. Court passes case for Attorney Morin to check with Attorney Fragoso. 
Case recalled at 2:41 p.m. Defendant Charles W Smith in court, in custody with attorney Kelsey Morin for attorney Jorge Fragoso.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles W Smith
Current: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2014)
Prior: 15642 West Ridge Road, New Berlin, WI 53151

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with  victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Charles W Smith in court, in custody.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has a P & P hold also.   Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant would like to be seen by the public defender.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Bail can be review at the next court hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
